# How to create MAC for Stø token service ISO API.

## Introduction

All messages and responses to the ISO API are protected by a Message Authentication Code (MAC). This mechanism ensures both the integrity and authenticity of each message, confirming that it has not been tampered with and originates from a trusted source. The MAC is generated by the entity connecting to the ISO API, such as a POS aggregator or processor, typically after receiving a payment message from a payment network and performing detokenization to retrieve the funding PAN. Once the funding PAN is obtained, the payment process can continue securely.

This document provides a step-by-step guide for creating a MAC for ISO messages, using examples from Thales Payshield 10k. Other Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) may also be used, provided they support the required cryptographic operations.

## Exporting protected MAC key from HSM.

Using the shared MAC Key Encryption Key (KEK), a random MAC session key is generated and securely exported from the HSM. For illustration purposes, the following value is used:

Wrapped key: D0144M6AC00E00000DB97F430EF5FE7839125445749AD6477439749EA17F35F4E1132C076114CC3D87099D9B5612849B68F462E05B1931848C7AE73D4DAB89ABBC31215F2E7623E5

This wrapped key needs to be used in field-48 together with the MAC index. A complete field 48 with MAC key index 1 looks like this:

0010011002144D0144M6AC00E00000DB97F430EF5FE7839125445749AD6477439749EA17F35F4E1132C076114CC3D87099D9B5612849B68F462E05B1931848C7AE73D4DAB89ABBC31215F2E7623E5

## Constructing input to MAC operation

With the data from the payment network and the constructed field 48, the fields of the ISO message could look like this:

    Field-3 : [000000]
    Field-4 : [000000002100]
    Field-7 : [1224170000]
    Field-14 : [2908]
    Field-18 : [1520]
    Field-19 : [250]
    Field-22 : [070]
    Field-23 : [000]
    Field-37 : [172544206765]
    Field-42 : [4992           ]
    Field-43 : [STØ Token Service     /0026 /Oslo                  /NO ]
    Field-48 : [0010011002144D0144M6AC00E00000DB97F430EF5FE7839125445749AD6477439749EA17F35F4E1132C076114CC3D87099D9B5612849B68F462E05B1931848C7AE73D4DAB89ABBC31215F2E7623E5]
    Field-49 : [978]
    Field-55 : [9F02060000000021009F03060000000000009F1A020250950500000000005F2A0209789A031801099C01009F37040F010E0382021A809F360200019F10200FA501A081010000EEAF28C68381C2ED0F0000000000000000000000000000009F2608A1A717065FF030A3]

### Producing binary encoding of the iso message

The fields of the detokenization message is converted to an ISO message. Please not that the field bitmap need to to have the presence of field 64 set.

Using the example the binary version of the message looks like this:

    

#### Transforming input

The MAC operation is performed on the transformed message. The default method is to apply SHA-256 - 64 rounds. Using the input in previous example, the following input to the MAC s produced.

    277AB4951A20BCB9982ED4CD9A0DD1CB30AFBD581B9246A5F0423151BCB60C54

#### MAC

Once the transformed input is complete, the MAC function can be applied. Using the HSM, the MAC can be produced. In this example we will use AES-CMAC according to RFC-4493

The result of the MAC is:

    7A046E168CA023C11AFDEF0ED721DECA

## Complete message

Once the MAC is produced, it is added to field-64 of the ISO message.

### Field summary

    MTI    : 1100
    BitMap : {2, 3, 4, 7, 14, 18, 19, 22, 23, 37, 42, 43, 48, 49, 55, 64}
    Field-2 : [503200******6254]
    Field-3 : [000000]
    Field-4 : [000000002100]
    Field-7 : [1224170000]
    Field-14 : [2908]
    Field-18 : [1520]
    Field-19 : [250]
    Field-22 : [070]
    Field-23 : [000]
    Field-37 : [172544206765]
    Field-42 : [4992           ]
    Field-43 : [STØ Token Service     /0026 /Oslo                  /NO ]
    Field-48 : [0010011002144D0144M6AC00E00000DB97F430EF5FE7839125445749AD6477439749EA17F35F4E1132C076114CC3D87099D9B5612849B68F462E05B1931848C7AE73D4DAB89ABBC31215F2E7623E5]
    Field-49 : [978]
    Field-55 : [9F02060000000021009F03060000000000009F1A020250950500000000005F2A0209789A031801099C01009F37040F010E0382021A809F360200019F10200FA501A081010000EEAF28C68381C2ED0F0000000000000000000000000000009F2608A1A717065FF030A3]		 
    Field-64 : [7A046E168CA023C11AFDEF0ED721DECA]

### Encoded message

The binary data needs to be encoded as base64 for transmission. The complete message encoded in base64 looks like this:
